voices but I I came here this afternoon

II was a friend of mine he was a friend

first and Philip Haney was one of the
originals to to be hired on for the

he began he began tracking the flow of

database that database tracks something
by the stood by my memory madam speaker
so that's my disclaimer about 800
individuals who who were at least on the
suspect list of what those who might be
positioning themselves to bring forth
another attack on America if we could
remember what that was like in 2001 and
I think what it was like for Phil Haney
stepping up in a way that he had to
educate himself in the Arabic language
he had to understand the culture he had
to understand the history and then he
had to track logistics and other
characteristics he built a database a
database that was an indicator database
on whether and if there might be another
another attack that was rooted in the
ideology that took down the Twin Towers
and bombed the Pentagon and put the
plane down in Pennsylvania Phil Haney
was a patriot when I first met Phil
Haney it was in a quiet careful room
over here just off the Capitol little
ways and I knew a little about his story
but when I first heard his story he was
concerned then that he would be a target
by people and he had a thumb drive with
a lot of data on it I don't know how
many gig it was hang on a lanyard around
his
knack he kept that with him and I
understood that that information was
also deposited in a remote location or
two or more so there was a redundancy if
anything happened to Phil Haney that
data would be accessible to the people
whom he trusted I imagined the most so
that was his insurance policy that he
wouldn't be killed and then over the
years Phil Haney and I'm going to say
seven or eight years of this very active
Phil Haney wrote a book called see
something say nothing
that was the orders he got out of the
administration at the time the madam
Speaker and yet Phil Haney had developed
the this the research and the database
that he said in in the last few years of
his life might have could have and I'll

might have and could have prevented the

hatred and but that information was
scrubbed it was scrubbed from Department
of Homeland Security by order from on
high how high up in the administration
at this point I don't know that we do
know we do know that the former director

also to be the case for all of the
documents in the FBI so that there was
nothing derogatory about Islam anywhere
in all those research documents that's
part of the work that Phil Haney was
doing and Phil Haney was then tracking

but also his ability to track credit
card numbers phone calls and those
things so that he could he could see who
was talking to whom where they were
traveling where they were gathering and
that data informed him but the order
came down scrub all of that out of your
database and he never said publicly that
he downloaded that information before
the scrub came down but he didn't deny
it either
he was this directly honest man and
whatever Phil handy said you
could always believe but the the
administration came in his bosses and
essentially took over his computer and

that they said he should not be
following because I guess it's under a

reflects a prejudice against their
religion we know that the people that

and put that plane down in Pennsylvania
were all of the same religion but they

Speaker I I say this because a week ago
today Phil Haney died and he was found
dead along the road out in a rural area
in California with a gunshot wound in
his chest which I imagine it was very
close to where that thumb drive hung
from the lanyard around his neck that
was how he kept that data with him at
all times
Phil Haney did carry for his own defense
when there were people that would come
and talk to him just one-on-one he often
said to them you're taking a risk
talking to me because you could become a
target too and he had said to friends as
recently as two weeks before his death
if there's an announcement that I if I'm
dead and there's a suicide letter it
will be a fake and he often said I would
never commit suicide I think the law
enforcement people regret that within
the first 24 hours a story came out that
it was a suicide that has been retracted
since then and I'm talking with people
that are on direct contact with the
investigators and that includes the FBI
and local sheriff's department they they
tell me that they are the investigation
and the death of our friend Phil Haney
our patriotic friend that investigation
madam Speaker is starts with a
presumption that it's homicide and works
its way through looking for everything
and it'll be a very deep and careful
investigation forensics of all kinds I
wrote a whole series of questions
down and the response I got back was you
will have answers to all of these and
many more well I expect those answers we
insist that we get those answers and I
and I do expect that we will get them
but I can't be convinced the Phil Haney
committed suicide I knew him too well
I've talked to at least a dozen of his
close friends since that period of time
that also said the same thing the
instant the news hit them they knew that
Phil had already he had already prepared
us to know that he would never commit

Christian man he had he had lost his

found a new love and was scheduled and
was called scheduled it to be married in
April of this year just a little over a
month from now he had everything to live
for he was finishing another book the
information the data didn't again didn't
get a complete dump at all in his first
book that which I said was see something
say nothing and the second book was
close to being finished he was preparing
for his wedding he had joy in his heart
he had he had energy he had ambition and
even those that speculated that he might
have gotten a health a health notice
that was discouraging Phil Haney would
he if he had a terminal notice if the
doctor had said you've got two weeks to

have used every moment he could to
complete his work and finish the book
and make sure that all of that
information and data was in the right
hands and that the people that had it in
their hands would know what it meant and
what to do with it and who would best
put their eyes on it to continue the
work that he had dedicated and I believe
now gave his life for I want to honor
when I'm standing here on the floor
saying madam Speaker that I don't
believe Phil Haney committed suicide I
expect we're gonna get a thorough
investigation the evidence that is
coming to me indicates that he was
murdered we don't know that yet and but

and so I honor Phil Hainan his life he
was a noble noble patriot and he knew
that he was he was using using the days
of his life he didn't know if it was
going to be the last days but he was
concerned it would be and it turned out
to be the last days of his life stepping
up to defend America to defend the rule
of law to protect our 330 million people
here and that's what cost him his life
in my view
madam Speaker so I honor Phil Haney and
to honor his memory we also need to

warrants it and expected will the

American and speaking of those folks
that really do step up and make a
